features: For infants who can sit unassisted up to 50 pounds | Meets Disney size requirements |Reversible handle allows baby to ride parent facing or forward facing | Stroller is also as a travel system when paired w/ compatible car seats (car seat sold separately)

Car seat compatibility: This stroller fits the following infant car seats (car seats sold separately): Greco snug ride, click connect 30, 35, 40, evenfall nurture, evenfall embrace.Care & Cleaning: Spot or Wipe Clean
Ideal comfort: Extendable European-style canopy with pop out UPF 50+ sun visor; Reclining seat with three positions; Adjustable footrest; Child tray with cup holder swings away for easy ins and outs

Makes traveling easy: Stroller includes large storage basket under the frame; Quick and compact fold; Extremely safe: JPMA certified; Five-point safety harness; Reflective piping to ensure you can be seen at night

Smooth ride: 7" front swivel lock wheels; 8" shock absorbing back wheels--linked brakes lock both rear wheels by pressing a single pedal; Assembled dimensions: 33.9"L x 20.5"W x 42.9"H; Folded dimensions: 21.3"L x 9.8"W x 31"H; Weight: 20.9 pounds
body.description: Designed to adapt to your child's growth, the Jeep Unlimited Reversible Handle Stroller can be used as travel system with any compatible infant car seat, as a parent-facing stroller or as a forward-facing stroller. Without disturbing your child, the reversible handle flips, and allows your little one to face you for interaction, or face forward to discover the world. Additional features like a compact fold, full coverage UPF 50+ canopy for sun protection, and removable child tray with cup holder help make your everyday adventures effortless. Car seat compatibility: This stroller fits the following infant car seats (car seats sold separately): Greco Snug Ride, Click Connect 30, 35, 40, Evenfall Nurture, Evenfall Embrace Since 1941, the Jeep brand has been a symbol of freedom and expression. Influenced by a love of the great outdoors. Jeep kids' products are created for life's little adventurers.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Assembled dimensions: 33.9"L x 20.5"W x 42.9"H; Folded dimensions: 21.3"L x 9.8"W x 31"H; Weight: 20.9 lbs. | Recommended Use: For infants who can sit unassisted up to 50 lbs. About Jeep Since 1941, the Jeep Brand has been a symbol of freedom and expression. Influenced by a love of the great outdoors, Jeep kids products are created for little adventurers. Jeep Unlimited Reversible Handle Stroller Available in Grey Tweed With an innovative design that caters to you and your little adventurer's needs, the Jeep Unlimited Reversible Handle Stroller epitomizes form and function for the modern, on-the-go family. Growing with baby, it features a reversible handle that allows your little one to easily ride parent-facing or forward facing. Its advanced features create a superior, safe and comfy strolling experience with the ultimate in convenience for you – turning every outing with baby into an effortless adventure! Three Ways To Ride: Reversible handle allows baby to ride parent facing or forward facing | Turns into a travel system when paired with compatible car seats Car Seat Compatibile: Fits the following infant car seats (car seats sold separately): Greco Snug Ride, Click Connect 30, 35, 40, Evenfall Nurture, Evenfall Embrace Ideal Comfort: Extendable European-style canopy with UPF 50+ sun visor; 3-position reclining seat, Adjustable footrest, Swing-away child tray with cup holder for easy ins and outs Supreme Safety: 5-point safety harness, Reflective piping for safe night strolls Smooth Ride: 7" front swivel lock wheels; 8" shock absorbing back wheels | Linked brakes lock both rear wheels by pressing a single pedal Convenient Travels: Large storage basket under frame for baby essentials | Quick and compact fold

Product Features Reversible Handle Grows With Baby! Innovatively designed to accommodate baby's growth from infancy to toddlerhood, this stroller features a reversible handle that allows baby to effortlessly ride parent-facing or forward facing. With this reversible feature, baby and parent can enjoy quality bonding time or baby can simply enjoy the sights. Optimal Comfort For Baby A sophisticated set of features offer your little one the ultimate in comfort. A European-style, extendable canopy offers ideal protection from the elements with a UPF 50+ sun visor. A 3-position, reclining seat and adjustable footrest offer additional comfort, while a child tray with cup holder swings away, enabling easy access into and out of the stroller. Supreme Safety Outfitted with features that create a superior and exceptionally safe ride for baby, this stroller sports a 5-point safety harness to keep baby securely strapped in. Reflective material on the safety harness and piping enable safe nighttime strolls.

Additional Product Features High Performance For Smooth Rides The outstanding suspension system features 7" front swivel lock wheels and 8" shock absorbing back wheels, that make it easy to glide over bumps in the road, creating an effortlessly smooth ride. The linked brakes lock both rear wheels by pressing a single pedal. Unlock the wheels for easy maneuverability; lock them for added stability on bumpy surfaces. The Ultimate In Convenience A generously-sized storage compartment underneath offers easy access to all of your own and baby's essentials, while a quick, compact fold offers offers easy storage and portability - keeping you prepared for whatever adventures come your way! Create Your Own Custom Travel System This stroller allows you to easily create a custom travel system, extending its versatility and value. Fits the following car seats (car seats sold separately): Greco Snug Ride Click Connect 30, 35, 40 Evenfall Nurture Evenfall Embrace

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great stroller! Reclines Flat!
reviews.reviewText: My favorite features are the handle & the recline;1. Handle: The handle easily flips to the opposite side for a forward or parent facing stroll. The downside to this is when you are parent facing, the front wheels (originally the back) don’t rotate, making it difficult to turn since the drive is now leading with the wheels fixed on an axle. When the handle is in the original position (baby facing outward), the handle sits high and when the handle is flipped to the opposite side (baby facing you) the handle will fall lower— you can’t adjust the height of the handle, so for me (5’3”) I feel the handle is too high but it’s not really an issue and you get used to it. Also, bc of the handle’s flip-able feature and shape it might be difficult to attach a stroller caddy on it but a diaper bag can still be attached to it.2. Recline: My favorite feature is that the seat fully reclines to almost 180 degrees flat (I believe it’s technically 170). It’s flat enough that you can use it as a changing table. This is Perfect if you don’t like taking your baby to small or dirty bathrooms and public changing tables. Also, if you’re solo and have other kiddos with you, you don’t have to worry about hauling everyone into a bathroom, you can change diapers right in the stroller with a simple recline. It basically turns into a bassinet.Other details:I don’t understand the excess fabric on the canopy, it doesn’t allow for extra coverage so it just sits like a tail. I wish the fabric of the seat was softer but my baby doesn’t seem to mind it. It folds and unfolds very easily. Since there isn’t a caddy space on the handle (which in most strollers would include a cup holder) I wish the child’s tray had two cup holders instead of one.Overall, this is a great, solid stroller, it has all the important features and it’s a fair price.Assembly: The assembly was super simple with exception to attaching the back wheels to the back axle- pushing the pins in to secure the wheels was difficult. Apparently others had issues with this too, but once you pop the pins in there everything else comes together very easily, no tools required.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Jeep made an excellent stroller that is easy to fold up and place in the vehicle. It is a little heavy, but I honestly love the durability of this stroller. It is well worth the expense. The tray is easily removed and the harness is adjustable. The double wheels allow for easy handling and maneuverability.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great stroller for the price
reviews.reviewText: Good stroller for the price. Very light weight and easy to fold up. Love that the handle can be positioned to see the baby. Also easy to clip in our Graco car seat. 4 stars because sometimes the wheels get stuck when pushing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I LOVE this stroller
reviews.reviewText: So, I received a graco jogging stroller as a baby gift and I HATED it so I went on a search for an affordable stroller that was easy to maneuver. And this stroller was it. It was very easy to assemble and much lighter than my graco. It’s easy to collapse and set back up. You can even set the back or front wheels to stay straight. My graco snug ride car seat clicks right into it and can be rear facing because you can switch the handle either way! I love how you can lay the seat all the way down so very easy to change a diaper in or have them take a nap! I do with they had a parent cup holder but it’s not the end of the world. The storage is a little small but my diaper bag easily fits over the stroller handle. Overall, I love this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I don't know where to start With this stroller/ Pram...Okay this stroller is not balanced on the side walks it controls you. Going all over the place. The reverse makes it worse. It goes sideways and you fight to keep it going straight when you're done from walks or erands you're supper exhausted. Make sure you always strap in your baby because if hit a bump on the side walk they will literally slide out the bottom of the hand rail. Another experience I had was it was going smoothly until one part of the side way had a crack and one of the wheels went in the dip and it almost tupple over to the side. More over if the side walks / pavement is only 1/4" inch high it can't even go over." If you have back pain this stroller is not for you." You literally need to bend down and put one of the front wheel forward on the sidewalk/ pavement. I took it spin at the nearest trader Joe's and I place some of my goods in the tray which by the way is really small if u have a diaper bag. Took much weight makes if off balance as well. I'm sorry I got this stroller.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great idea but some flaws
reviews.reviewText: The idea of the stroller is great however there are some minor things I don’t like. First, it did not come with the Jeep logo on the canopy. I messaged the seller and NO response. I saw a lot of reviews saying the same thing and I was hopeful I would be the exception but no. That’s ok I can live without it. When baby is facing me it is a little difficult to steer but you learn to steer it in that manner. Takes getting used to. The wheels aren’t the smoothest when going over bumps.. it takes some pushing. I had to return my first stroller and order a new one because the handle cracked on both sides when slightly pushed down to get the back of the stroller up above a short step. We were shocked it was such cheap material. Amazon was kind enough to replace it but I have to return my original. That will be impossible with how big it is…!It is not an easy fold and unfold and it is big bulky and heavy. The wheels are in the way when baby is facing me but I can learn to walk around it and I don’t have large feet. Husband on the other hand has a frustrating time with it.Assembly was okay.Baby LOVES it because she can see mama and sit up and look all around her. She is 11 mo and does tend to slouch and lean to one side because the straps aren’t too tight but I make it that way because then she can’t sit up.Sad that it doesn’t come with cup holders.All in all. I ordered the second replacement and plan to continue using it bc it’s cheap and it gets the job done which is for my daughter to face me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Amazing stroller! Great quality and roomy enough for my toddler.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very good value for the money I love that it flips back and forth for a nice hike or leisurely stroll it goes from a bassinet on wheels to a regular stroller in 2 seconds.
Muy resistente y funcional aunque es algo pesada, la compramos pensando que sería fácil de manipular y trasladar pero si es pesada y ocupa mucho espacio en el auto.
Excellent Product from Delta Children (Jeep). Very sturdy & easy to manoeuver around. Bought this during Amazon sale, hence totally worth it!
Le hicimos un regalo a mi hermano para su primer bebé y le encanto, exactamente como en la descripción. Solo que tardo más del tiempo esperado en llegar pero en general tofo bien.
